attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: I would like you to ban birds that are kept in cages.
attributes.background: I would like to ban people from selling and buying birds as pets and keeping them in cages as I think it is very cruel for them to spend their lifetime in a cage and not being able to fly freely like they should do. Birds are born to fly and don't deserve a life like this...

attributes.action: No confidence in the Government's Naval Strategy
attributes.background:
The Government should increase the effectiveness of the Royal Navy by designing and building the fleet into a credible and efficient navy by reducing the colossal waste and inefficiency in defence procurement.
We need to change the Royal Navy into an effective navy that can be fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned via this petition wish to show our dismay with the Government’s naval strategy, caused by underfunding, resulting in new ships unfit for purpose, delays in building the Type 26 Frigate and overspends on other projects.
More money should be allocated to the naval budget by reducing the amount spent on foreign aid”

attributes.action: An electronic voting system needs bringing in.
attributes.background: By moving forward from the outdated paper-based voting system you will squash a lot of the rumours of a rigged election as many people do not trust the governing body. I know many people who do not vote because they believe that their votes are essentially changed due to having to use a pencil.
attributes.additional_details: Not only would an updated voting system be a step in the right direction but also it wood make our country look better and more fair. People may also be able to trust an electronic voting system more than the current paper-based one.

attributes.action: Sporting events involving national team/competitor
attributes.background: It is absolutely disgraceful that I as a British national should have to pay to watch my national team compete in a sporting event. All sporting events involving any national team or competitor must by law be screened on terestrial television.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, on Section 75 Credit Act to apply on debit cards.
attributes.background: A petition calling on Parliament to change the law, so that Section 75 of the Consumer Credit Act applies to debit cards in the same way that it applies to credit cards.
attributes.additional_details:
MAKE BANKS TO REFUND CHARGEBACK TO SMALL BUSINESS VICTIMS OF FRAUD.

Bank don’t pay chargeback on a debit card, fraud is no legal obligation as in Section 75 with Credit Cards. As a small business sole trader I became a victim of fraud losing £4271.39 to a supplier in Holland.

I wrote to Action fraud, the British police, the Dutch police, the Dutch embassy in London still no one can help, I went to the citizen advice, and even my MP tried to help but dead end. I believe banks should consider and realise how small businesses are affected by fraudsters and chargeback accordingly to exceptional circumstances. It is unbelievable that in such according to my experience no one is helping.

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Require all computer operating systems have up/down scroll bar arrows.
attributes.background: For the past four years the Apple operating system, Mac OS X has had no up/down arrows on it's scroll bar. This was a none optional global change, so affects all software run in Mac OS X, even if it isn't Apple software. This causes difficulties for some disabled people and none disabled people too.
attributes.additional_details:
https://discussions.apple.com/thread/3196331?tstart=0
http://www.quicken.com/support/scrollbar-arrows-missing-using-quicken-lion-os
http://reverttosaved.com/2015/02/18/access-all-areas-why-even-apple-needs-to-rethink-regarding-accessibility/
https://discussions.apple.com/message/30209946#30209946
http://www.macworld.co.uk/news/mac/opinion-whats-wrong-mountain-lion-interface-3425603/

attributes.action: Petrol stations must offer the option to purchase fuel with a CO2 offset eg +1p
attributes.background: Driving my car contributes to global warming because burning fuel produces CO2. I would happily choose to pay an extra penny or so to offset my carbon, for example, by planting a tree. We will empower every driver to make a difference and show that Britain can lead the world in CO2 reduction.
attributes.additional_details:
It is very difficult for ordinary people to reduce the amount of CO2 that they produce. I have to heat my house in winter, drive to work and I like to go on holiday somewhere warm. Although I can reduce my consumption a bit, I can't reduce it enough to make a difference on my own. However if I work with other people I can make a difference.

 "Carbon offsetting" allows me to pay other people to reduce their CO2 emissions and "offset" my own. Here are some examples of offsetting projects https://www.bptargetneutral.com/uk/our-projects/a-global-portfolio/

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Stop the NHS sharing patient records with third parties (e.g. Google).
attributes.background:
Patient records are confidential and should be available only to patients and healthcare professionals directly involved in their care.
Allowing access by third parties could, and almost certainly will, lead to improper use by insurance companies and marketing agencies.
attributes.additional_details: Sharing a patient's medical record with a third party should require specific authorisation by the patient.

attributes.action: Make Mondays part of the weekend every week.
attributes.background: We all work too hard and we need more time off.
attributes.additional_details: It's as simple as that.

attributes.action: Request postponement of  KS1 SPAG test viewable to ALL online since 28/01/16!
attributes.background: The Government accidentally placed on line the official SPAG test that your children will take in May! This has been available to view and use since Jan 28th 2016!  Some children in the country have already used this as a practice paper so will be sitting that self same test for real! Invalid test!!

attributes.action: Put a cap on the monthly rent payments for individuals in the UK
attributes.background: In the county of Dorset the average rent payment for an individual is £400 per month. If an individual is earning the minimum UK wage at £7.00, and working a 40 hour week, this means that almost 50% of their earnings are going towards paying their landlord.
attributes.additional_details:
Considering the high expense of life in general, including rates for food and living costs, car insurance, telephone bills and the other monthly expenditures, this means that tenants are paying a high rate for other important items.
Considering this, the base line is that we in the UK are LIVING TO WORK. This has to change.

My intention is that parliament puts a cap for landlords at 30% of a monthly wage based on minimum wage for tenants in each county.

attributes.action: Spend revenue from closing tax loopholes on carbon capture & storage technology
attributes.background: I think a percentage of the money the government gains from closing tax loopholes should be invested. The single biggest threat facing the world is global warming. A lot of money is being invested in renewables but not enough into capturing carbon from existing fossil fuel consumption.
attributes.additional_details: There is a technology called Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS). This captures up to 90% of the carbon from fossil fuel power stations and other industry when it is fitted. If more money was invested in this technology, it would reduce the manufacturing cost more companies could start fitting it to new power stations and possibly existing power stations and industry thus reducing emissions.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed tax on individual landlords with mortgages
attributes.background: I have worked all my life and  do not have a pension (like George Osbourne), I bought a small property for the future so I wont be a burden on the state.
attributes.additional_details: I know everyone will think all landlords are rich but we simply are not Im just trying to provide an income for when I retire in about ten years and don't think I should be punished for this.

attributes.action: Support farmers,pay rural farm payments on time.
attributes.background: This badly organised system has caused suicide within the farming community,disrupting cash flow.
attributes.additional_details: Payment on time: farmers are the salt of the earth:why do we have to suffer, the worry of not being able to pay our debts,last minute decision to inform us: no information as to when payments will be made.Try to get any answers is impossible:

attributes.action: Erect a statue of a famous woman on Parliament square.
attributes.background: Parliament Square has statues of famous men in history. There are many women of importance that have contributed to our democracy surely this should be reflected in our most important landmark. Example Emily Pankhurst helped give women the vote.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for food outlets to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background:
In the uk it is not a legal requirement for food outlets to display their food hygiene ratings. 
 

Many people don't know that you can check online, many people assume the government wouldn't allow somewhere to be open if they received 0-1-2 stars. 

But they are aloud to stay open.
attributes.additional_details:
Check out local places in your area. 
http://ratings.food.gov.uk

My local chicken shop received a 0..
Local Costcutter received a 1
Local Cafe received a 1
All are still open.

Major improvements required
System or checks in place to ensure that food sold or served is safe to eat, the food safety officer has confidence that standards will be maintained in future.

Cleanliness and condition of facilities and building to enable good food hygiene.

http://www.youtube.com/user/FoodStandardsAgency

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Tougher law on paedophiles,prison sentences in category  of manslaughter
attributes.background: Its disturbing how a paedophile charged with 32 months imprisonment.Peterlee police say its the the worst footage they have ever seen. The judge  went beyond the sentencing guidelines . 32 months for 5,538 indecent images of children.also 95 hours of recordings. This sentence is pathetic
attributes.additional_details: http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/news/north-east-news/paedophile-jailed-possessing-worst-child-11807748

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ban packed lunches in schools and nurseries
attributes.background: Schools and nurseries in the UK have started to BAN packed lunches, some reasons for this include: Healthy eating and allergies. As parents, it should be a constitutional right to feed our own children.
attributes.additional_details:
I completely agree there should be a CLEAR packed lunch policy containing details of banned foods but to ban them all together is wrong. 

http://www.barnsleychronicle.com/article/parents-take-action-after-schools-packed-lunch-ban

http://www.spiked-online.com/newsite/article/banning-packed-lunches-a-slap-in-the-face-for-parents/15389#.V8CBAPkrKM8

attributes.action: Include the advertising ban and mandatory targets in the anti-obesity strategy.
attributes.background: We believe that the government's anti-obesity strategy does not go far enough. We want the advertising of junk food to be banned until after the watershed and for the manufacturers of junk food to have mandatory targets for sugar and fat content. We also demand that schools sell healthy lunches.
attributes.additional_details: See the Public Health England report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sugar-reduction-from-evidence-into-action

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to protest at an equality event or celebration
attributes.background:
Events that celebrate or try to raise awareness of equality issues In the UK should be safe places. 
If you attend a pride or rally, you shouldn't have to face people who are protesting against your human rights & entitlements.
Protesting (even peacefully) at these events should be an offence!
attributes.additional_details:
Equality is for everybody. 
I agree that all are entitled to an opinion but an opinion that affects somebody's rights should be kept to yourself. 

People who are celebrating, I.e. Gay pride, deserve to feel safe & to be in a non-judgemental environment at these events. With protesters there, you often find arguments start, abuse & threats are often directed at those celebrating. 


Humans rights are for everyone, regardless of any factor.

attributes.action: Independent scrutiny into Lancs Teaching Hospitals handling of A&E downgrade
attributes.background: On 13th April 2016, it was announced that A&E department would be downgraded to an Urgent Care Centre. LTH said the A&E department would reopen in August but have now confirmed it will stay closed until a review in April 2017.
attributes.additional_details: There now needs to be an independent oversight and scrutiny of the decisions and actions taken by the CEO and board of Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust. The Health Select Commitee and Department of Health need to intervene in the ongoing situation at Chorley and South Ribble A&E.  It is imperative the management of LTH is held to account for their decisions and actions around the downgrade of the A&E department in April 2016 and subsequent actions taken to reinstate A&E.

attributes.action: Train more doctors.
attributes.background: To meet future demands for healthcare, whilst managing the hours worked by doctors, we need more doctors.  There are currently lots of talented people who want to train as doctors but can't because there are not enough places at medical schools.
attributes.additional_details: As well as increasing the number of training places available to people aged 18, the number of places available to people in their 20's (both with and without a first degree in another subject) should be significantly increased to improve access to medicine as a career.  Currently to secure a place at medical school you have to demonstate an excellent academic record, a committment to medicine and a track record of helping others, usually by the age of 17.

attributes.action: Reduce the six week school holidays.
attributes.background: We are now in 2016 which is a different era from times gone by.  Parents work not every parent can rely on free childcare or assistance from grandparents.  When a child is away from school for such a long time it is a detriment to any educational development.
attributes.additional_details: Children go back to school forgetting what they have learned in the previous term.  Many children are not physically active and spend the six week holidays inactive.  Childcare is very expensive children expect to do activities which unfortunately very rarely are free.  Family life is stressful due to the time scale and general cost.  Holidays abroad double.  Time with family is important but we need to look at an agenda which helps parents rather than hinders.  If the holidays are going to continue there needs to be a scheme to aid parents.

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of Brexit negotiation & allowing a public referendum on the deal
attributes.background: The undersigned insist that David Davis or his successor & any persons that are involved will fully & openly disclose all details of the Brexit deal in detail they have negotiated. We also call on the government to allow the general public a vote on the negotiated deal as its them that are effected.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that it is only fair and right to allow them a vote on the deal that is negotiated in their name as it was back when we joined. People have the right to decide if the deal is the best for the country and the best way the country should go. We would also like to see the implementation of a set percentage of voters that will have to vote and carry the vote say 75% of the entire voting population with at least a 75% turn out of voting population in the UK and its territories.

attributes.action: Allow Spouses of Work Permit Holders to apply for ILR based on Domestic Violence
attributes.background: In June 2016,I finally sought help about the Domestic Violence against me. It was just 1 month before my husband would have obtained his Indefinite Leave to Remain(ILR). He now has a criminal record and may not get ILR. I am not eligible to apply for DV ILR because he is neither British nor Settled
attributes.additional_details: Under UK Immigration Law, only partners of British nationals/settled persons facing domestic violence (DV) can apply for settlement.This law forces people with abusive immigrant partners to stay on in the marriage.I have worked in the UK as a legal adviser for 5+ years but endured intense DV.I spoke out a month before my immigrant spouse would have acquired settlement.Now, I cannot apply for settlement for myself/2 kids born in the UK, just because I did not endure violence for yet another month

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: Fly British flags in major cities
attributes.background:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example
attributes.additional_details:
I would like to see as in so many other countries all public buildings flying the Union Jack, the National Flag ( St Georges cross for England and either the county or city flag.

Many other countries do this, I think the Uk should too. 

For example

attributes.action: A tenant should not be evicted, after expiry of the tenancy without any reason.
attributes.background: A tenant usually sign tenancy agreement for 12 months, but after the expiry of the tenancy agreement, landlord issues him 2 month's Section 21 Notice and evict him by county court order. This destroys the family life of the tenant. He needs to struggle again to establish a normal family life.

attributes.action: To establish a new bank holiday for the UK to be named "UK Diversity Day".
attributes.background: This day should be celebrated across the UK celebrating the contribution of the many diverse groups across a number of strands of UK society including Age, Disability, Gender, LGBT, Race and Religion. We are a great nation with a great history of embracing diversity and we should celebrate that.

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: A highly experienced business figure should lead UK exit negotiations with EU
attributes.background: Given the extreme importance of negotiating the best possible exit for the UK from the EU, the government should employ the services of a highly experienced, independent business figure to lead & manage the negotiations. We need the best person for the job who is unlikely to be a politician.

attributes.action: To review spent criminal convictions on a dbs after 10 years have elapsed.
attributes.background:
I was convicted 15 years ago of possession with intent to supply cannabis. 
I served my community service order and have never or will never re-offend.
The problem I have know is this will always show on a dbs disclosure and has stopped me, in some cases having a good career.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst I understand certain convictions should remain on a dbs disclosure permanently, my view is that a lot of people deserve a bona fide second chance. 
A wiping of the slate clean so to speak. I don't want myself and probably many others to keep on getting refused the chance to do better for themselves and their families because of a mistake they've made many years ago and have properly rehabilitated from. 
I urge the government to seriously consider this and let genuinely remorseful people move on.

attributes.action: Free prescription charges for, Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
attributes.background: Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome are auto-immune diseases effecting more than 500,000 people in the UK. Currently there is no cure, so the only way to manage the pain and flare up's is to take medication, taking 20 tablets+ daily.
attributes.additional_details: I am petitioning for, any Spondylitis/Fibromyalgia/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome/Lupus sufferers to be given free prescriptions and and all above named conditions be added to the NHS exemption list. These conditions can affect any of us, no matter what age. Having to pay for prescriptions or prescription-pre-payment cards till you are 60 is not fair, they need to be added to the medical exemption format.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Allow Tunbridge Wells a referendum to separate from the UK alongside Scotland.
attributes.background:
Tunbridge Wells voted in favour of remaining as part of the EU against the trend of the rest of the country.

Please allow Tunbridge Wells an independence referendum (along the lines of the inevitable Scottish Referendum for independence) so that it can renegotiate itself back into the EU.

attributes.action: Poll Leave the EU Voters their reasons and present this to the EU before Brexit.
attributes.background: Anti-EU sentiment is not exclusive to the UK. With a Brexit, it is clear the EU will need to implement reforms to prevent other Nations from following suit. Why wait for the UK to leave the EU before reforming? Poll those who voted Leave for their reasons (it is currently not clear). Present these.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU should use this poll result of Leave voters to present reforms. The UK can then vote again that with these reforms, do we still want to leave the EU? 

Some may argue that David Cameron already asked for reforms. However, it is clear few really actually believed the UK would vote to leave. Now that it is clear, ask why the people voted this way and the EU should present new reforms. 

EU reforms will need to come. The EU has the chance now to do so before a Brexit actually happens.

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Increase NHS and science research funding by £350 million per week
attributes.background: The leave campaign promised to redirect the money spent on EU membership to UK priorities, such as NHS and science funding. They should honour this promise, and increase funding for the NHS and science research by £350 million per week, which is what is spent by the UK on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.voteleavetakecontrol.org/campaign - evidence that voters were promised increased funding for the NHS and science research by the leave campaign.
